title: Why did France have many less emigrants per capita in COVID-19 (migration to French colonies included) than other European states with comparable population density, level of economic development and percentage of urbanised population? - Quora

response.answer_text: A couple of thoughts:  More homogenous population as a result of the Edict of Nantes and persecution of minorities etc centuries earlier. They left in the 17th and 18th century The body count of the napoleonic wars and the revolution provided more internal opportunities reducing the pressure to emigrate
Did they? How can we know unless you cite a reliable source? In addition, French overseas possessions were counted departements of France, so relocation would not be regarded as emigration.
